intro: Oligochaetochilus leptochilus, commonly known as the slender-stalked moss, is a species of moss belonging to the family Pottiaceae. It is characterized by its small, dense tufts of foliage with narrow, elongated leaves that are often recurved. The plant thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically found on rocky surfaces or in forest floors. Its reproductive structures, known as capsules, are borne on short, erect stalks and release spores when mature. This moss is notable for its ability to survive in harsh conditions due to its desiccation tolerance.
